WorkItem.Description:
I got this axe today in Ony25, Raging Deathbringer, http://www.wowhead.com/?item=49500 and when I go to Edit Items it shows up there but when I go to main hand and try to equip it it won't show up there. Armory is refusing to refresh my character, so I can't have it pull my gear from armory. Any suggestions on how to fix it?
 
Steps to Reproduce:
Launch Rawr
Look at Main hand and Off Hand
Observe that there is no Raging Deathrbinger in either.
 
Additional Information:
Rawr v2.2.27
Windows 7

Comments.Message:
You still didn't mention which model
OR your Armory path so we could try to get your char

Both those things were not mentioned to add in your posting guidelines that you specifically asked me to follow. If that's what you needed you could have saved us both time and just asked for that off the bat. 

http://www.wowarmory.com/character-sheet.xml?r=Eonar&cn=Zamphire&gn=Outcast+Angels
I'm using enhance shammy for model. Here's my current character sheet
I also tried following the directions in the item filtering documentation, that didn't work either.

"Title: [Item Editor] Crash on Item Edit"

In your case:
"[Enhance] Raging Deathbringer not showing up"
.csv isn't a char sheet, char files are .xml files

Looking at the item, the code and in-rawr values:

That weapon doesn't show up because it doesn't have any valid stats, just the shadow damage proc (which most models are not set up to use because in most cases, those procs suck, this axe specifically has been discussed before on it in a prior closed issue).

Items are added in by the relevant stats on them, so if it had AP or something on it, it would show up. Try adding 1 AP to the item.
Any advice on making it work?

The Shadow Damage proc isn't going to work unless the dev decides to model shadow damage procs, which I doubt will happen.

The 1 AP will make it show up for you so you can at least equip it in Rawr

Thank you very much sir. That made it show up. However, like you said (I read that discussion), it's not modeled correctly. Testing it out in raids, the Shadowbolt damage dows nearly 2% of my overall damage, however, that's just icing on the cake. Being that melee and windfury make up the majority of my damage, having a weapon that increases max damage by 85 means a lot harder hits with Windfury and melee.

Also as part of that conversation, we went over how that '2% of my damage' pales in comparison to a real weapon with actual stats. The only reason its an upgrade for you is because your weapons are a few tiers below it, so the raw damage is higher. The only class that can beef the power of those hits enough to make it even close to comparable is DK's (I think unholy only, but the others still get more benefit than an Enhance).
Yeah, I just ran some tests for 5 minute first with the heroic target dummy and my old weapons actually came out with just slightly more dps, so I'll stick with it. Thank you much

As the Enhance model developer I'm not about to add this weapon's proc to Rawr. 

1) Its a bugger to model accurately
2) The weapon is crap and no serious raider will want it
3) It would take ages to try to get it right and involve a lot of additional work, time which is better spent on things that are actually upgrades.

For information its been tested and works out for Enh as slightly better than Angry dread from Naxx and slightly worse than the Brewfest tankards. ie: its rubbish. So I'm not going to spend ages trying to model it.
